p: Antibiotic therapy is one of the most important therapies used for treating bacterial infections and has tremendously improved human life from the days of its introduction. But in the past few decades, the development and spread of resistant pathogenic strains threatens human health globally [ 1]. The most important factor for developing resistance is the excessive exposure of bacterial strains to antibiotics [ 2]. Consequently, it is essential either to reduce/halt the use of antibiotics or to develop and use the alternative of antimicrobials.
